cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.SI. 

This paper deals with the information rate of secret sharing schemes, which is a topic in information theory (cs.IT). It also involves matroids, which are a combinatorial object studied in computer science (cs.DM). The paper discusses the security of the secret sharing schemes, which is related to cryptography (cs.CR). The authors use mathematical techniques to derive their results, which could fall under the category of computational complexity (cs.CC). Finally, the paper could also be relevant to the sub-category of social and information networks (cs.SI), as secret sharing schemes are often used in distributed systems and networks.
